intro: Empogona talbotii, commonly known as the Talbot's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as Acacia and Eucalyptus. The plant has small, elliptical leaves and produces white or greenish-white flowers that are clustered in small inflorescences. Its berries are usually red or yellow and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can weaken its host plants if left unchecked.
